byline.contributor: Ian Lovett reported from Los Angeles, and Ashley Southall from New York. Liam Stack contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By IAN LOVETT and ASHLEY SOUTHALL

abstract: Lake County is engulfed in 50,000 acre fire exacerbated by worst California drought in history, destroying 1,000 homes; firefighters are struggling to vanquish inferno officials claim is unprecedented in speed and size; blaze could impact Napa Valley wine industry, with many employees living in county, on eve of harvest.
lead_paragraph: Two wildfires north of San Francisco had burned through more than 100,000 acres and destroyed at least 1,000 homes and commercial structures, according to state officials.

headline.main: Moving Fast, Fire Scorches Community in California
headline.print_headline: Californians Scrambling in Fire Season Like No Other

snippet: Two wildfires north of San Francisco had burned through more than 100,000 acres and destroyed at least 1,000 homes and commercial structures, according to state officials.
